description: From Latin prōmiscuus (“mixed, not separated”), from prō (“forth”) + misceō (“mix”).

adjectives.description: promiscuous (comparative more promiscuous, superlative most promiscuous)

entries.meaning: Made up of various disparate elements mixed together; of disorderly composition.

examples: A sail caught by a promiscuous wind.

entries.meaning: Having many sexual partners, especially if indiscriminate in choosing said sexual partners.
(networking) The mode in which an NIC gathers all network traffic instead of getting only the traffic intended for it.
